modules.description: This module implements primitives for constructing Mirage-based network servers with route filtering, middleware pipelines, and response generation. It operates on Mirage network stacks, HTTP request/response objects, and TLS configurations, utilizing `IO.t` for asynchronous operations. Typical applications include deploying secure web services, API endpoints, and virtual hosts with rate limiting and structured logging in MirageOS environments.

This module defines a module type `S` that specifies the required interface for implementing Mirage OS-compatible components. It works with abstract data types representing network stacks, clocks, and I/O devices, tailored for Mirage unikernels. Concrete use cases include structuring implementations of TCP/IP stacks or storage backends that can be compiled both natively and as Xen guests.
